alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 11:40AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL TAOS AND EAST CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM MDT... At 1140 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near El Rito, or 22 miles north of Espanola, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vallecitos, El Rito, Petaca, Ojo Caliente, Las Placitas, La Madera and Las Tablas. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 347 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
